subject: Re: [junit] JMUnit
msgSnippet: Brunno, In Open Source you can do it without needing to ask permission. When you are ready just announce on this list, http://testdriven.com , and
messageBody:
Brunno,

In Open Source you can do it without needing to ask permission. When you are
ready just announce on this list, http://testdriven.com , and
http://xprogramming.com . That should give you enough publicity to get
people to take a look at it.

Regards,
David
www.testdriven.com

On 5/9/06, Brunno Silva <brunno.silva@...> wrote:
>
> Dear list members,
>
> In the begining of the year, I started to use TDD in
> my projects, must of them, however, used the Java ME
> technology. JUnit doesn't workly properly in this
> case, because it uses the Java Reflection API. Soon, I
> discovered the J2MEUnit, but it's too poor documented,
> it's very difficult to use it. So, I created my own
> xUnit implementation, the JMUnit (Java Micro Unit).
> It's very primitive yet (the current version has done
> three months ago, in four hours), but it worked well
> in my projects. So, I had the idea to put this version
> in the source forge and start to aprimorate it. My
> question is: Do exist any formality to create and
> distribute a xUnit implementation or anyone can do it
> without problems?
>
> Sincerely yours,
> Brunno Silva
>
>
>
